intro: Dendrobium textile var. haematostictum, commonly known as the blood-stained orchid, is a rare and striking orchid species native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its vibrant, often red or orange-pink flowers with dark streaks, which give it its common name. The plant is an epiphyte, typically growing on trees in humid, tropical environments. Its pseudobulbs are cylindrical and covered in a dense layer of velvety, pale green or brownish hair. The flowers bloom in clusters and are known for their longevity, often lasting several weeks.
